intro: Oxyspora cernua, commonly known as the drooping oxyspora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its delicate appearance. Oxyspora cernua is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental qualities in garden settings.
